item.title: PHP media help =\
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:


I got it to work!(after many times testing)
here is my result!

<?php
//yeah, just an empty line, cuz i felt like it.
//yes another one dang it! so shut up!
// declare values
// ___________________________________________________________________________________
$playerx = '<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Transitional//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">
<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">
<head>
<meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1" />
<title>Music</title>
</head>

<body>
<OBJECT id="VIDEO" width="250" height="60" 
	style="position:absolute; left:0;top:0;"
	CLASSID="CLSID:6BF52A52-394A-11d3-B153-00C04F79FAA6"
	type="application/x-oleobject">
	
	<PARAM NAME="URL" VALUE="';
$playery = '">
	<PARAM NAME="SendPlayStateChangeEvents" VALUE="True">
	<PARAM NAME="AutoStart" VALUE="True">
	<PARAM name="uiMode" value="full">
	<PARAM name="PlayCount" value="9999">
	<PARAM name="stretchToFit" value="True">
</OBJECT>
</body>
</html>';
$radio192k = 'http://stream2.pulsradio.com/';
$radio64k = 'mms://87.98.140.58/wma/PulsRadio64k';
$radio24k = 'http://213.251.190.165:5050';
$music1 = 'runescape-';
$music2 = '.mid'; 
$server_address = 'http://www.kloplop321.com/rsmusic/';
//this is to shorten the code considerably.
// mode types
// ___________________________________________________________________________________
// audio type
if ($_GET["mode"] == "0") {
$modey = "0";
	} elseif ($_GET["mode"] == "1") {
$modey = "1";
	} else {
$modey = "0";
}
//this is line: 31
// radio mode type
if ($_GET["radio-type"] == "0") {
$radio_type = "0";
	} elseif ($_GET["radio-type"] == "1") {
$radio_type = "1";
	} else {
$radio_type = "not_defined";
}
if ($_GET["music-id"] != "") {
$music_id = $_GET["music-id"];
} else {
$music_id = "error";
}
if ($_GET["music-id"] == "radio"){
$music_id = "radio";
}
//im doing this twice due to lack of knoledge in php
if ($_GET["music-id"] == "Radio"){
$music_id = "radio";
}
// if code
// ___________________________________________________________________________________
if ($modey == "0") {
if ($music_id == "radio") { // if it is set to radio
// radio quality
if ($radio_type == "0") { //192k
echo $playerx . $radio192k . $playery;
	} elseif ($radio_type == "1") { //64k
echo $playerx . $radio64k . $playery;
	} else { //24k
echo $playerx . $radio24k . $playery;
} //end of radio quality
	} else { //midi start
	echo $playerx . $music1 . $music_id . $music2 . $playery;
//old, will not work if quick-time is current player(on client )_
//echo '<embed src="runescape-'.$_GET["music-id"].'.mid" loop="true" autostart="true">';
}
	} else {
if ($music_id == "radio") { // radio in mode 1
echo 'Sorry but this mode does not support the radio =(';
 } else { // midi in mode 1

	$fileHandle = 'runescape-' . $_GET["music-id"] . '.mid';
//
header('Date: ' . date("D M j G:i:s T Y"));
header('Last-Modified: ' . date("D M j G:i:s T Y"));
	header("Content-Type: audio/mid");
		header("Content-Length: " . (string)(filesize($fileHandle)) );
header("Content-Transfer-Encoding: Binary");
readfile($fileHandle);
}
}
//
//____________________________________________________________________________________
//
?>

The only thing left is to conjur up something when no variables are given, it just returns blankety-blank… but i am proud of my sucess! still need one last thing though.
[center]^
|[/center][br][size=1]Posted on: January 01, 2007, 11:21:31 PM[/size][hr]also, it seems that the application/x-oleobject thingy isn’t allowed in firefox, is there an alternative to that?

Read full topic

item.title: PHP media help =\
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

lets just say the new rep system uses a different table part of the database for rep instead of the default one, this way:only community members, mods, and admin’s are the only ones who can change karma. I mean rep means not much, i would sometimes just add a random statement to anyone for no reason what-so-ever, though some noobs decided that rep meant everything, created accounts to alter their main forum accoun’ts rep and therefore this needed changing, i think it should be senior member + able to alter rep.

EDIT: I only said this for informational purposes.

Thats why i want to use a php file that will return the file’s data also with the content-type thing so it will be the same as opening a midi or mp3 file. Understand?

In other words this is exactly like a dynamic picture script, but instead with audio files. Understand this time?

item.title: PHP media help =\
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

well i am trying to make a thing so i can go to like music.php?name=radio&quality=0
but i will put quality in later(i know how to do that part)

Im trying to do this kind of like dynamic images. here is cruels tutorial on dynamic sigs: http://cruelclient.com/cruelsnet/index.php?showtopic=64&st=0
also here is where php header discussion is: http://us2.php.net/header go to “alex dot pleiades at gmail dot com”'s post.

What i am trying to accomplish: a dynamic music for windows media player(in vb .NET) by php content-type coding. If you have another solution that will equily work please post that.(I am doing this for vb .NET and i wont stop)

Do not say quit 
Do not say "vb sucks, use something else" or ANYTHING LIKE THAT, or in any other language.
Do not post anything that wont be of help at all in anyway what so ever.(that includes a fake link to meatspin)

my code:

<?php if ($_GET["music-id"] == "Radio") { //echo '<embed width="320" height="50" src="http://213.251.190.165:80/" autostart="true" showstatusbar="1" type="application/x-mplayer2" ></embed>'; $fileHandle = 'http://213.251.190.165:80/' // header('Date: ' . date("D M j G:i:s T Y")); header('Last-Modified: ' . date("D M j G:i:s T Y")); header("Content-Type: audio/mpeg"); header("Content-Length: " . (string)(filesize($fileHandle)) ); header("Content-Transfer-Encoding: Binary"); readfile($fileHandle); } else if ($_GET["music-id"] == "radio") //echo '<embed width="320" height="50" src="http://213.251.190.165:80/" autostart="true" showstatusbar="1" type="application/x-mplayer2" ></embed>'; $fileHandle = 'http://213.251.190.165:80/' // header('Date: ' . date("D M j G:i:s T Y")); header('Last-Modified: ' . date("D M j G:i:s T Y")); header("Content-Type: audio/mpeg"); header("Content-Length: " . (string)(filesize($fileHandle)) ); header("Content-Transfer-Encoding: Binary"); readfile($fileHandle); else { //echo '<embed src="runescape-'.$_GET["music-id"].'.mid" loop="true" autostart="true">'; $fileHandle = 'runescape-'.$_GET["music-id"].'.mid' // header('Date: ' . date("D M j G:i:s T Y")); header('Last-Modified: ' . date("D M j G:i:s T Y")); header("Content-Type: audio/mid"); header("Content-Length: " . (string)(filesize($fileHandle)) ); header("Content-Transfer-Encoding: Binary"); readfile($fileHandle); } // // ?>

Please help
